channel.title: I think Windows doesn't like me
channel.description:
Specifically, it ran a startup repair after my computer crashed, and, despite saying I would only lose recently installed programs, the only things left are Tag: the power of paint, steam, firefox, (without bookmarks) and maybe a few other programs I have sitting around but don't use. I don't even have system preferences or my desktop background.
Also, McAfee security is still here, but doesn't want to work.
Shit happens?

item.title: I think Windows doesn't like me
item.dc:creator: sersoft
item.description:
antivirus programs are known to stop a certain percentage of threats and torrents will always be safer than file sharing sites but the only thing that can save you from unwanted software is common sense

Read full topic

item.description:
See, i have Mcaffe, it runs in silent and has given me NO hassle. if i go to a page i think could be dodgy/unchecked my google and Mcaffe i wouldnt go to it, but rarely you’ll find a useful page which is virus infested tbh.

and if your that adamant on free porn don’t torrent or visit bad sites. buy it.

item.source: I think Windows doesn't like me

item.title: I think Windows doesn't like me
item.dc:creator: GilCMassey
item.description:
FireTime:

There hasn’t been a virus that can do hardware damage since like the windows 2000 era. And about all they did was turn off the system fans so it would overheat and in most cases shutdown. Before that there were some that could change/damage/remove your bios but those were never very widespread and were created for older operating systems.

It was a rare one. I don’t remember the name, this happened a year ago…

Samapico:

… Dude… you can’t “lose” a computer because of a virus… Virus are software and don’t mess with the hardware (except maybe in extremely rare cases? I dunno? Worst I can think of is something that fucks with the BIOS…), a simple re-format and your computer is brand new.

Read full topic
item.source: I think Windows doesn't like me

item.description:
i reinstall windows maybe 3-4 times a year to get rid of crap i always have laying around. it’s not that big of a deal, just get the files you want out with dropbox/memorystick/live cd

item.title: I think Windows doesn't like me
item.dc:creator: Samapico
item.description:
0_22one:

It said it got rid of a virus, but it didn’t. the computer cost me 2000 dollars, and I almost lost it. Thank God I don’t trust any part of mcaffee, otherwise, I wouldn’t be typing this right now, on this computer at least.

… Dude… you can’t “lose” a computer because of a virus… Virus are software and don’t mess with the hardware (except maybe in extremely rare cases? I dunno? Worst I can think of is something that fucks with the BIOS…), a simple re-format and your computer is brand new.

Read full topic
item.source: I think Windows doesn't like me

item.title: I think Windows doesn't like me
item.dc:creator: papernick
item.description:
Pyro:

I see. I’m not really in a position to change my antivirus right now, but I’ll take consider your advice for the future.

why? both avast and avira are FREE and way better than mcafee.

Also, I now think the problem might actually be that windows has problems logging in; it says I’m using a default account because it can’t log into mine or something. In any case, I hope to get a completely new computer soon, but I don’t have any money or a job, and my dad says I have to pay for half of it now. :\

Edit: I think I’m right; by using the “recently changed” feature, I can find some of my files, most of which work. It’s weird, though, because none of my stuff is there; for instance, I downloaded Minecraft.exe to the “downloads” folder (forgot to configure my firefox options), but it’s not there when I navigate to it.

Edit 2: I would like to just start over clean, but there’s a few files and things I want from my old computer. Plus, I’m unsure what’s wrong, so a complete reinstall may not be necessary. It’s a good thing I’m paranoid enough to save my really important files online :retard:

1- use a live cd,
2- backup needed/important files,
3- format,
4- install windows.

Read full topic

item.title: I think Windows doesn't like me
item.dc:creator: Lukagerm
item.description:
Pyro:

I think Windows doesn’t like me

It’s nothing personal. Windows doesn’t like anybody.

It sounds like one of those problems where it seems like Windows is just fucking around with you and won’t tell you what’s going on. If you find a way to get to vanilla or factory default, you’ll have peace of mind. Until then, it can be really confusing and annoying.
Best of luck.

Read full topic

item.title: I think Windows doesn't like me
item.dc:creator: Pyroclase
item.description:
I see. I’m not really in a position to change my antivirus right now, but I’ll take consider your advice for the future.

Also, I now think the problem might actually be that windows has problems logging in; it says I’m using a default account because it can’t log into mine or something. In any case, I hope to get a completely new computer soon, but I don’t have any money or a job, and my dad says I have to pay for half of it now. :\

Edit: I think I’m right; by using the “recently changed” feature, I can find some of my files, most of which work. It’s weird, though, because none of my stuff is there; for instance, I downloaded Minecraft.exe to the “downloads” folder (forgot to configure my firefox options), but it’s not there when I navigate to it.

Edit 2: I would like to just start over clean, but there’s a few files and things I want from my old computer. Plus, I’m unsure what’s wrong, so a complete reinstall may not be necessary. It’s a good thing I’m paranoid enough to save my really important files online :retard:

item.title: I think Windows doesn't like me
item.dc:creator: Maverix26
item.description:
?? ^what?

Mcaffee sucks because of many reasons. The biggest ones being that its uses a butt load of resources in the background, has alot of interference, and has really bad detection rate. If you want a good anti virus, i suggest avira, or avast anti virus.

Oh yea, on topic: If I was in your case, I would just format the drive and re install windows. From what you’ve said so far, your computer must’ve hated you d:

Edit: Oh yea, I’ve heard of RATS that can delete windows core files, and really fuck you up, maybe that’s what happened?

Read full topic

item.title: I think Windows doesn't like me
item.dc:creator: papernick
item.description:
Pyro:

How do I do that, exactly? And I don’t think recovery tools are what I need, since windows itself technically deleted everything.

REcovery tools are basicly an installer that copies that hidden partition to your main partition, formatting it in the process. the way to be able to use it depends on the brand and model.

also, get a better antivirus than mcafee.

Read full topic
